channel.title: Major Digest - Reliable and Comprehensive News Sources: world
channel.description: Get the latest news online at Major Digest, the top online news resource for the most reliable news sources. Stay informed about the world around you!

image.title: Major Digest - Reliable and Comprehensive News Sources: world

item.title: Aid workers rush to deliver relief in hurricane-stricken Jamaica
item.description: KINGSTON, Jamaica (AP) — Rescuers and aid workers fanned out across Jamaica on Saturday to distribute food and water and reach communities still isolated four days after Hurricane Melissa ravaged the island.
item.dc:creator: JOHN MYERS, JR., Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Israel says the latest remains returned from Gaza are not bodies of hostages
item.description: JERUSALEM (AP) — The remains of three people Hamas handed over to the Red Cross in Gaza do not belong to any hostages, Israel said Saturday, in the latest setback to the U.S.-brokered ceasefire in the Israel-Hamas war.
item.dc:creator: RENATA BRITO, Associated Press, The Hill

item.title: Israel says remains of three people handed over by Hamas do not match any deceased hostages
item.description: Israel's forensic testing reveals that remains of three people returned by Hamas don't match any of the deceased hostages from the Oct. 7, 2023, attacks.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Top diplomats from Germany, Jordan and the UK call for an immediate ceasefire in Sudan war
item.description: DUBAI, United Arab Emirates (AP) — The foreign ministers of Germany, Jordan and the United Kingdom jointly called on Saturday for an immediate ceasefire in the war in Sudan, describing the situation there in stark, apocalyptic terms after a paramilitary force seized the last major city in the East A
item.dc:creator: JON GAMBRELL, Associated Press, PIX 11

item.title: Tanzanian President Hassan wins disputed election with more than 97% of vote, official results show
item.description: Tanzanian President Samia Suluhu Hassan has won a disputed election with over 97% of the vote, according to official results announced on Saturday.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press, Local 4

item.title: US national intelligence director says former American strategy of 'regime change' is over
item.description: DUBAI, United Arab Emirates (AP) — The U.S. national intelligence director told officials Friday in the Mideast that America’s former strategy of “regime change or nation building” had ended under President Donald Trump.
item.dc:creator: JON GAMBRELL, Associated Press, PIX 11

item.title: Military strikes on Venezuela appear increasingly likely
item.description: The U.S. launching strikes within Venezuela is looking increasingly likely as the Trump administration continues to bolster the buildup of military assets in the region, turning up the pressure against Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro, whom U.S.
item.dc:creator: Filip Timotija, The Hill

item.title: Militia attack on hospital in Darfur came in waves, WHO says
item.description: CAIRO (AP) — Groups of gunmen who reportedly killed at least 460 people at a hospital in Sudan attacked in several waves, abducting doctors and nurses, then gunning down staff, patients and people sheltering there, the World Health Organization said Friday.
item.dc:creator: SARAH EL DEEB and JAMEY KEATEN, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Trump designates Nigeria as 'country of particular concern' over widespread Christian persecution, killings
item.description: Christian persecution in Nigeria has ramped up dramatically as Islamist militants burn villages and kill thousands of believers in targeted attacks across the country.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Russia deploys 170,000 troops for push in Ukraine's Donetsk region, Zelenskyy says
item.description: KYIV, Ukraine (AP) — Russia has deployed around 170,000 troops in Ukraine’s eastern Donetsk region where they are trying to capture the stronghold of Pokrovsk in a major push for a battlefield victory, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said Friday.
item.dc:creator: ILLIA NOVIKOV, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Aid teams flock to Jamaica to help with Hurricane Melissa recovery
item.description: David Archer, deputy governor of the British Virgin Islands, told NewsNation he's seen many organizations eager to help.
item.dc:creator: Anna Kutz, NewsNation

item.title: China's Xi promises to protect free trade at APEC as Trump snubs major summit
item.description: GYEONGJU, South Korea (AP) — Chinese leader Xi Jinping told Asia-Pacific leaders on Friday that his country would help to defend global free trade at an annual economic regional forum snubbed by U.S. President Donald Trump.
item.dc:creator: HYUNG-JIN KIM, KIM TONG-HYUNG and HUIZHONG WU, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: US defense chief vows to 'stoutly defend' Indo-Pacific interests in talks with China
item.description: KUALA LUMPUR, Malaysia (AP) — The U.S. Secretary of Defense said Friday he told his Chinese counterpart during talks in Malaysia that Washington would “stoutly defend” its interests in the Indo-Pacific. He also signed a new agreement aimed at strengthening security ties with India.
item.dc:creator: EILEEN NG, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Rio favelas left reeling after lethal gang raid as families bury the dead
item.description: RIO DE JANEIRO (AP) — Families of the scores of people killed in a deadly gang raid by Rio de Janeiro police began burying the dead on Thursday, with residents left reeling by the scenes of carnage and livid at law enforcement whom they accuse of excessive force, torture and extrajudicial killings.
item.dc:creator: ELÉONORE HUGHES, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Cruise ship allegedly leaves 80-year-old woman behind on island, daughter demands answers after death
item.description: Family demands coronial inquest after cruise ship allegedly abandons 80-year-old passenger on remote Australian island, leading to her death during luxury voyage.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Death toll from Rio de Janeiro police raid on drug gang rises to 121
item.description: RIO DE JANEIRO (AP) — The death toll in a massive police raid targeting a drug trafficking gang in Rio de Janeiro rose to at least 121 people, authorities said Thursday.
item.dc:creator: ELÉONORE HUGHES and GABRIELA SÁ PESSOA, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Ultra-Orthodox protesters in Jerusalem rally over Israel’s draft exemption as clashes break out
item.description: Ultra-Orthodox protesters flooded Jerusalem to oppose military draft requirements, adding further pressure on the government of Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Red Cross receives two coffins of deceased hostages in Gaza Strip, IDF says
item.description: Israel said the Red Cross reported receiving "two coffins of deceased hostages" during a transfer in the Gaza Strip and is brining the remains to IDF troops.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Tariffs, trade and TikTok: Takeaways from Trump-Xi meeting
item.description: Trump said he and China’s Xi left the nearly two-hour meeting with newfound solidarity on a laundry list of issues.
item.dc:creator: Libbey Dean, NewsNation

item.title: Haiti, Jamaica and Cuba pick up the pieces after Melissa's destruction
item.description: Stunned residents wandered about, some staring at their roofless homes and waterlogged belongings strewn around them.
item.dc:creator: ARIEL FERNÁNDEZ, ANDREA RODRÍGUEZ, JOHN MYERS JR., Associated Press, NewsNation

item.title: Trump cuts China tariff after Xi signals tougher fentanyl enforcement, rare-earth pause
item.description: Trump announced a cut on Chinese imports after meeting with Xi in South Korea, citing new understandings on fentanyl enforcement, farm trade and rare-earth exports.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Trump directs Pentagon to start testing nuclear weapons
item.description: President Trump said Wednesday that he has instructed the Defense Department to immediately begin testing U.S. nuclear weapons on an equal basis to China and Russia. “The United States has more Nuclear Weapons than any other country,” Trump wrote.
item.dc:creator: Filip Timotija, NewsNation

item.title: 4 Senate Republicans vote to rebuke Trump in midst of Canada tariff spat
item.description: The Senate voted 50 to 46 on Wednesday to eliminate President Trump’s authority to impose steep tariffs on Canada, something he exercised again in recent days by ramping up tariffs on the country by another 10 percent because of a television ad that criticized his policies.
item.dc:creator: Alexander Bolton, NewsNation

item.title: Israel's military says ceasefire is back on as death toll from Gaza strikes reaches 104
item.description: DEIR AL-BALAH, Gaza Strip (AP) — Israel’s military said Wednesday that the ceasefire was back on in Gaza after it carried out heavy airstrikes overnight across the Palestinian territory that killed 104 people, including 66 women and children, according to local health officials.
item.dc:creator: WAFAA SHURAFA and JOSH BOAK, Associated Press, WGN 9

item.title: Mexico worries its citizens might get blown up at sea by US
item.description: “We are not in agreement with these interventions, and we have a protocol that has yielded results,” Mexican President Claudia Sheinbaum said.
item.dc:creator: Julian Resendiz, NewsNation

item.title: As Trump meets Xi, Republicans push for release of detained Americans
item.description: The meeting between Trump and Xi in South Korea is largely focused on coming to a ceasefire in an escalating trade war.
item.dc:creator: Laura Kelly, NewsNation

item.title: Antisemitic attacker faced 30-year sentence, gets less than 1½ years in plea deal
item.description: Tarek Bazrouk, a 20-year-old Palestinian American, was sentenced to 17 months in prison for federal hate crimes after attacking Jewish protesters in New York City.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Putin says Russia's nuclear-armed underwater drone was tested successfully
item.description: MOSCOW (AP) — Russia has conducted a successful test of a new atomic-powered and nuclear-capable underwater drone, President Vladimir Putin said Wednesday, declaring that the new weapon can't be intercepted.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press, NewsNation

item.title: No date to let Mexican cattle into US as work on sterile flies continues
item.description: Mexican Agriculture Minister Julio Berdegue said on Wednesday that Mexico and the United States have not yet set a date to resume Mexican cattle exports amid an outbreak of the flesh-eating screwworm parasite.
item.dc:creator: NewsNation

item.title: New Jersey man's Titanic belongings recovered expected to auction for more than $100K
item.description: Frederick Sutton's Titanic personal effects, including gold watch and first-class passenger list, remain in family hands for over a century before auction.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Trump extends friendly hand to Xi in fraught relationship with China
item.description: Friday's meeting marks the first time the two leaders have seen each other face-to-face in six years.
item.dc:creator: Laura Kelly, NewsNation

item.title: Trump arrives in South Korea for key talks ahead of APEC summit, Xi meeting
item.description: Donald Trump visits Seoul for talks with President Lee Jae Myung focused on trade, investment, and maintaining stability amid growing tensions in the Asia-Pacific region.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Amnesty says deadly US strike on Yemen prison may be a war crime
item.description: An American airstrike in April on a prison run by Yemen's Houthi rebels killed more than 60 detained African migrants.
item.dc:creator: JON GAMBRELL, Associated Press, NewsNation

item.title: Trump visits South Korea as he attempts to secure billions in investment
item.description: President Trump met South Korean leader Lee Jae Myung in Gyeongju, discussing partnerships during the Asia-Pacific Economic Cooperation summit.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Category 5 Hurricane Melissa brings flooding and catastrophic winds to Jamaica
item.description: KINGSTON, Jamaica (AP) — Heavy floodwaters swept across southwestern Jamaica, winds tore roofs off buildings and boulders tumbled onto roads Tuesday as Hurricane Melissa pummeled the Caribbean island as a catastrophic Category 5 storm, one of the strongest Atlantic hurricanes on record.
item.dc:creator: DÁNICA COTO and JOHN MYERS JR., Associated Press, NewsNation

item.title: At least 64 killed in Rio police raids ahead of climate conferences
item.description: Police have often conducted large-scale operations against criminal groups ahead of major events in Rio.
item.dc:creator: Rodrigo Viga Gaier / Reuters, NewsNation

item.title: Plane crashes while flying tourists to Kenya's Maasai Mara, killing 11 people
item.description: NAIROBI, Kenya (AP) — A plane crash killed 11 people, mostly foreign tourists, in Kenya’s coastal region of Kwale early Tuesday while they were en route to the Maasai Mara National Reserve in heavy rain.
item.dc:creator: EVELYNE MUSAMBI, Associated Press, NewsNation
